Duuude!!!

text: What if Lyle can write cursive, but not read it?

name: haradaya
text: I want to chubby this, but it would ruin the perfect 100.

name: evilbobikus
text: I'm sure after Lie Bot's comment, Lyle spend much time practicing his cursive penmanship.

name: evilbobikus
text: Afterwards making sure to write everything in cursive to show off his new ability.

name: evilbobikus
text: To the point that he now carries a fountain pen at all times.

name: weretrout
text: I don't think Lie Bot was wrong, but just lying .

name: zem
text: guys. i think lie bot was lying. not wrong.

name: deimosrising
text: You guys know the alt text tells you to reference that strip, right?

name: hollis
text: Oh snap!  I thought I was being clever.

name: overmedicated
text: I don't read alt texts, my mouse hand has a nervous tick. Or something.

name: soticoto
text:
I thought you were being clever too.
You have betrayed my trust!
I CAN NEVER BELIEVE YOU AGAIN!

name: firesign
text: I'm so late here that nobody will read this, but it rather appears that the alt-text is directing us to the strip wherein Lyle's calligraphy skills are introduced, rather than the oft-above-referenced strip featuring Lie Bot's vicious comment about Lyle's cursive literacy. The latter seems to be the antecedent to your pronoun "that," so assuming I am not mistaken about your intent, this post can be viewed as a "correction."

name: kelsotimebomb
text:
I read it!

Don't be sad!

name: saint
text: how do you read an alt text from the commenting area?

name: deimosrising
text: Can't yet, it's apparently difficult to implement in this setup. I follow along on the normal site when I'm making my comments. Chris has said a couple places that it will be in as soon as they can make it work

name: catachresis
text: A comment left by catachresis was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by GeyserShitdick, equinn2006, fakedaisies)

name: straw
text: For real, I only noticed the alt text in general like 3/7 of the way through and I still usually never think to check it out.

name: jordstar
text:
The alt text definitely changes the experience of the strip... I think it's a matter of personal preference, whether the alt-text improves or ruins it. I enjoy the alt-text.

I'm rereading the archives with the comments for the first time. I absolutely do not mean to be a troll when I say this, but I much prefer the comics without the comments. It's interesting to see what people had to say, and I appreciate the chance to discuss something we all love. It's just too repetitive to read alongside every comic:

1. "gush"
1a. "gush about rating this strip more than 5"
2. "display of Achewood knowledge"
2a. "oneupmanship or chubby/props of said display"
3. "I totally say/do the thing in this strip in my life now"
3a. "I totally would say/do the thing in this strip if I ever get the chance"

Nothing wrong with love for Achewood. If anything I am a little weirded (in the good way) that it's affected so many people in the same way it's affected me! But I recommend against reading Achewood and treating the comments as a companion/expansion/extra punchline in the same way as one might do with Achewood's alt text.

name: epicurus
text:
This comment is SO awesome - I would chubby it more than once if that were possible. It's a cut above his insightful but unfortunately redundant comments on double music and Airwolf - perfect delivery. I will have to start deconstructing things now in my own life - like movies and so forth!
;)

name: slalvation
text: A

name: slalvation
text: apparently you can't do a "plus."

name: soticoto
text:
I keep getting told I'm awarding too many chubbies.

I'm too friendly... =(

*Goes to stand by Philippe*

name: semiquaver
text: *chubbies for irony*

name: songbirdspectre
text: *glee*

name: rowboat
text: jordstar cold turned this whole mutha out. That list (though it could be several items longer) is so right on. I think I've been wanting to leave a comment like this for a long time, but I doubt I would've ever put it all together at the right moment.

name: stuart
text: IT'S ALIVE

name: catachresis
text: Ray puts "me" in what I presume would be mental air quotes. This is kind of amazing.

name: epicurus
text: This happened to me in London once. It was a corner store, not a currywurst stand.

text: Lyle's got some seriously good penmanship

Tschuss.

text: No!  And they're stingy with the ice!

text: the ol' ray " toss the paper over my head " maneuver

name: f1shst1ck
text: I love Lyle's Calligraphy. He has more complexity and depth than he appears to have.

name: wfl
text: It would appear Lyle may be the original creator (or inspiration for) the Shelly Script Allegro typeface.

name: fjak
text: where is the eszett in tschuß WHERE IS IT WHERE IS IT

name: lobster_mobster
text: This reminds me of the time I spent an entire day in Puerto Vallarta just sitting outside this one taqueria. I would always wander off on some initiative to see the sights. The longest I was gone from the taqueria was about 15 minutes.

name: charchar
text: I remember when I first moved to Texas and I asked my new Puerto Rican friend what's a "Tah-kway-ree-ah."  She just started twitching at my pitiful attempt at Spanish (I got better.)

name: achilleselbow
text: I hope to see more examples of Lyle's written eloquence.

name: sp1derbaby
text: Does it still count as a complimentary close?

name: sp1derbaby
text: I only realised after reading the next strip that Ray was too insecure to order a Currywurst again. Four  hours!

name: triptaphane
text:
At first glance, 'loser' looked to me like 'lover'.


I was quite crestfallen upon re-reading it.

name: deusoma
text:
I absolutely love that he signs it
"You're an idiot,
Lyle."

name: st-elmos_fire
text: I have been told that you can get around in Berlin quite fine without knowing German, I have been told this by a friend from Berlin. Not that this strip isn't quite funny.

name: st-elmos_fire
text: then again doing anything in any strange city is kinda hard when you're by yourself.
